intro: Opuntia subarmata, commonly known as the narrow-armed prickly pear, is a species of cactus native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its flat, paddle-shaped stems that are ribbed and covered in spines. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers during the spring and summer months. Its fruit, known as a tunas, is edible and often used in local cuisines. Opuntia subarmata is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local wildlife.
